channel.title: Compare Your Favorite Operating Systems
channel.description:
[size=8pt]We don't have to show off pictures or anything fancy, just typing is necessary.[/size]
LINUX
I actually enjoy updating and modding the old 2001 model of novel's Open SUSE source. We have plenty of old and new Novel shit just laying around, so i mod and play around with it a couple of times when i'm bored, it's basically the only thing i can focus my attention on for over 24 hours without blinking. My specific favorite linux server however is also a SUSE, SUSE LINUX Enterprise Server 9 NOVEL is the full title of the case in which 4 cds containing no less than 261mb of data for the entire OS to be installed. I mod around with it when i have the chance on vmware's newest workstation software, but i really don't do that much other than update it and the drivers.
WINDOWS
I like to also play around with older versions of windows, i so far have an incredibly modded version of microsoft's windows NT (of course for private use, just don't tell microsoft ;) ). Then there is XP which is my main source of joy in life, i don't mod it much, aside from a few msstyles and some patches here and there.
I also have a few other systems i mess around with, including some old mac systems, windows 1.0 and 3.1, i also have managed to get me a copy of windows longhorn but after about 3 days or so the copy became corrupt due to the nature i acquired it.
And remember kids, don't download pirated operating systems as your main OS, it's a ton of bullshit full of Trojans and malware. Of course you know it all bastards probably already know that so why don't you just go correct me on this instead.

too much ram usage. (i got 512mb)

item.title: Compare Your Favorite Operating Systems
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

I like Windows 7 cause It has cool aeromics. (or w/e you call it)
I like Vista 'cause in the past 3 years of using it on my laptop, I haven’t encountered any problems (except 99999 crashes).

Read full topic

item.title: Compare Your Favorite Operating Systems
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I like Windows 7, cause it’s so pretty.
And I like Ubuntu, just cause it’s something different, and happens to be the only Linux distro I’ve used so far.

Read full topic

item.title: Compare Your Favorite Operating Systems
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Tough call between W2K and WXP. W2K has never failed me or showed a bug in the 6 years I used it, but XP looks better and is more compatible with stuff.

Read full topic
